That's great that you're making the most of your commute!

Regarding portable Wi-Fi hotspots with longer battery life, here are some excellent options to consider:

1. **Netgear Nighthawk M2 MR2100**: This hotspot has a massive 5040mAh battery, which can last up to 24 hours on a single charge. It supports up to 20 devices and has a maximum download speed of 2Gbps.
2. **Verizon MiFi 8800L**: With a 4400mAh battery, this hotspot can last up to 24 hours on a single charge. It supports up to 15 devices and has a maximum download speed of 1.45Gbps.
3. **AT&T Netgear Nighthawk M1 MR1100**: This hotspot has a 5040mAh battery, which can last up to 24 hours on a single charge. It supports up to 20 devices and has a maximum download speed of 1Gbps.
4. **GlocalMe G4 Pro**: This hotspot has a 5350mAh battery, which can last up to 15 hours on a single charge. It supports up to 10 devices and has a maximum download speed of 150Mbps.
5. **Skyroam Solis X**: This hotspot has a 4700mAh battery, which can last up to 16 hours on a single charge. It supports up to 10 devices and has a maximum download speed of 150Mbps.

When choosing a portable Wi-Fi hotspot, consider the following factors:

* Battery life: Look for hotspots with high-capacity batteries (measured in mAh) for longer usage.
* Speed: Check the maximum download speed (measured in Mbps or Gbps) to ensure it meets your needs.
* Device support: Consider how many devices you need to connect simultaneously.
* Carrier compatibility: Ensure the hotspot is compatible with your carrier or has a compatible SIM card slot.
* Portability: Look for compact and lightweight designs for easy carrying.

As for your transportation costs, using your commute to get work done is a great way to make the most of your time. You might also consider exploring alternative transportation options, such as carpooling, public transportation, or ride-sharing services, to reduce your monthly expenses.

I hope this helps you find the perfect portable Wi-Fi hotspot for your needs!
